meanings.definition: Anhingas: a type of bird known for its long neck and sharp bill
meanings.sent1: The anhingas gracefully glided through the water in search of fish.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of anhingas perched on the tree branches near the lake.
meanings.sent3: The anhingas decided to have a fishing competition to see who could catch the most fish.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as sharp as the bill of an anhinga.
meanings.sent5: The anhingas' long necks stretched out elegantly as they dived into the water.

meanings.definition: Anhingas: plural form of anhinga, referring to multiple birds of this species
meanings.sent1: We spotted a flock of anhingas flying in formation across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The anhingas nested together in the tall trees of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The anhingas held a meeting to discuss their upcoming migration plans.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the anhingas soaring high above was a majestic display of nature.
meanings.sent5: The anhingas' synchronized movements in flight were a mesmerizing sight.
